COURSES.name: Africa in World History
COURSES.description: One-semester introduction to African history for undergraduates. Links the history of African societies with other world civilizations by focusing upon major historical themes. (H and N)

COURSES.name: Africa to 1800
COURSES.description: Ancient Africa, the expansion of Islam, savannah kingdoms, East African trading cities, maritime contacts with Europe, the slave trade. (H and N)

COURSES.name: Special Topics in African History
COURSES.description: Selected variable topics in the history and culture of Africa.
COURSES.prerequisites: Credits: 3; can be repeated with change in content up to 18 credits; Prereq: 3 credits of an AFH, AMH, ASH, EUH, LAH, or WOH course.

COURSES.name: United States to 1877
COURSES.description: Surveys the development of the U.S. from its colonial origins to the end of Reconstruction. (H) (WR)

COURSES.name: United States Since 1877
COURSES.description: Surveys the emergence of modern America as an industrial and world power; the Progressive Era; WWI; the Great Depression and the New Deal; WW II; and the Cold War era. (S and D)

COURSES.name: History of Disability in America
COURSES.description: How disabilities have been labeled, identified and treated over time and in light of broad social trends.

COURSES.name: United States Legal History
COURSES.description: Nontechnical survey of American legal development from its English common law origins to the present. (H) (WR)

COURSES.name: American Women in the 19th Century
COURSES.description: Examines women's history during the 19th century with a focus on how women gradually entered the public arena as laborers, reformers, writers, and performers.

COURSES.name: Women in Modern U.S.
COURSES.description: Introduces major events, trends and issues in the history of U.S. women from the Civil War to the present. (H)

COURSES.name: American Environmental History
COURSES.description: Substantive and interpretative inquiry of the historical roots of the nation's contemporary environmental issues. A comprehensive overview of the relationship between people and their natural physical surroundings from the Columbian explorations to the 1980s.

COURSES.name: Special Topics in American History
COURSES.description: Selected, variable topics in the history and culture of America.

COURSES.name: American Revolutionary Era, 1760-1789
COURSES.description: Analyzes the background of, and reasons for, the American Revolution, the social, military, political, diplomatic aspects of the era, as well as the constitutional developments of these years. (H) (WR)

COURSES.name: History by Hollywood
COURSES.description: Compares Hollywood films with traditional historiographic accounts to explore the cultural and political history of the 1950s, '60s and '70s, including the Montgomery Bus Boycott, civil rights, the Vietnam War and political assassinations.

COURSES.name: History of the Modern Middle East
COURSES.description: Surveys the history, politics and society of the Middle East from the early 19th century until the present day. Topics include transformation of Islamic empire to post-colonial states, development of collective identities, the formation of new social classes and changing gender relations.

COURSES.name: Special Topics in Asian History
COURSES.description: Variable topics in the history and culture of Asia.

COURSES.name: Special Topics in Asian History
COURSES.description: Variable topics in the history and culture of Asia.

COURSES.name: History Research Seminar: Asia
COURSES.description: Variable topics seminar with two distinct goals: introduce the historiography of a specific topic and produce a substantial research paper based on primary source evidence.

COURSES.name: The Early Middle Ages
COURSES.description: Studies the formation of the Medieval West from the dissolution of the Roman Empire to the year 1000 A.D. Emphasizes the ways in which Roman, Christian and Germanic traditions fused to form a new civilization. (H and N) (WR)

COURSES.name: Ireland in the British Empire
COURSES.description: Place of Ireland in the British Empire and the imperial experiences of the Irish people. Covers the main themes of Irish history from the Tudor conquest to the establishment of the Irish Republic, all the while being attuned to the broader imperial context.

COURSES.name: Modern European Jewish History
COURSES.description: Major events and themes of the Jews in Europe from 1650-1945.

COURSES.name: Special Topics in European History
COURSES.description: Selected variable topics in the history and culture of Europe.

COURSES.name: History of the Second World War
COURSES.description: Analyzes World War II, covering the origins, politics, resistance movements, grand strategy and consequences. (H) (WR)

COURSES.name: Society and the Sexes in Modern Europe, 18C to the Present
COURSES.description: Gendered analysis of great historical events, political movements and ideologies. Other topics of social and cultural history are discussed.

COURSES.name: History Research Seminar: Europe
COURSES.description: Through rotating in content, this seminar has two distinct goals: introduce the historiography of a specific topic and produce a substantial research paper based on primary source evidence.

COURSES.name: Special Topics
COURSES.description: Special topics in history. (H) (WR)

COURSES.name: History Practicum
COURSES.description: Learn the elements of the professional study of history: the critical reading of sources (primary and secondary); research skills; and a variety of historical methodologies.
COURSES.prerequisites: Credits: 3; Prereq: 3 credits of AMH, ASH, EUH, AFH, LAH, HIS, or WOH.

COURSES.name: Individual Study
COURSES.description: Individual study in history. (WR)

COURSES.name: Undergraduate Research in History
COURSES.description: Provides firsthand, supervised research. Projects may involve inquiry, design, investigation, scholarship, discovery, or application.

COURSES.name: History Research Seminar
COURSES.description: Through rotating in content, this seminar has two distinct goals: introduce the historiography of a specific topic and produce a substantial research paper based on primary source evidence.

COURSES.name: Internship in the Practice of History
COURSES.description: Gives history majors practical experience in history-related institutions and organizations, such as archives, historical societies, museums and university presses.
COURSES.prerequisites: Prereq: history major and undergraduate coordinator permission.

COURSES.name: History Honors Workshop
COURSES.description: Assists with all phases of the senior thesis, including project design, research, writing, and oral presentation. Students complete assignments that build toward a draft of a preliminary chapter or the introduction. The workshop provides a collaborative environment in which to pursue individual thesis projects.
COURSES.prerequisites: Prereq: acceptance into the History Honors program.

COURSES.name: Emergence of Latin American Nations
COURSES.description: The last phase of the colonial regime, movement for independence, and problems of nation-building to the end of the 19th century. (H and N) (WR)

COURSES.name: Colonial Latin America
COURSES.description: Surveys the formation of Spanish and Portuguese imperial systems and colonial societies in America in the 16th, 17th and 18th centuries. (H and N) (WR)

COURSES.name: Race, Religion and Revolution in the Black Caribbean
COURSES.description: Explores the history of Jamaica, Haiti, the Dominican Republic and the Miskito Coast of Nicaragua. Explains the emergence of colonial and neo-colonial political systems, the concept of race in relationship to slavery and global capitalism as well as the role of religion in revolutionary actions.

COURSES.name: Special Topics in Latin American History
COURSES.description: Selected, variable topics in the history and culture of Latin America.

COURSES.name: Modern Mexico
COURSES.description: Aftermath of independence and war with U.S., the Reform and Maximillian, Porfiriato, Mexican Revolution and contemporary trends. (H and N) (WR)

COURSES.name: History Research Seminar: Latin America
COURSES.description: Through rotating in content, this seminar has two distinct goals: introduce the historiography of a specific topic and produce a substantial research paper based on primary source evidence.
